request.description:
**This API is called by an NA for access authentication when the NA accesses open APIs of the IoT platform for the first time.
Using the authentication information, the NA then calls other APIs.**
**When the accessToken obtained by an NA through the Authentication API is about to expire, this API can be called to obtain a new accessToken.**
**When the gateway accesses a southbound API, this verification code is carried for obtaining the gateway ID and password.**
**This API can be used to update the passwords of devices.**
**NAs can call this API to check whether a specified device has been connected to the IoT platform and activated.**
**NAs can call this API to modify device information.**

**If a directly connected device that has been registered on the IoT platform does not need to connect to the platform, an NA can call this API to delete the device.**

**If the device needs to connect to the IoT platform again, the NA must register the device again.**
**An NA can call this API to query real-time location information of an NB-IoT device.**

**This API is used by an NA to query the device shadow information of a device, including the device configuration information (in the desired section) and the latest data reported by the device (in the reported section)..**
**The NA can call this API to modify the configuration information on the device shadow.**
**When an NA needs to perform an operation on a batch of devices, the NA can call this API to create a batch task.**

item.name: *2.3.2 Querying Information About a Specified Batch Task

request.description: **An NA can call this API to query information about the batch task.**

item.name: *2.3.3 Querying Information About Subtasks of a Batch Task

request.description: **This API is used by an NA to query information about a subtask of a batch task. **

item.name: 2.4.1 Querying Information About a Specified Device

request.description: **This API is used by an NA to query detailed information of a specified device.**
**This API is called to query device information in batches.**
**This API is used to query historical device data.**
**This API is called to query historical data about a device shadow.**

item.name: 2.4.5 Querying Service Capabilities of a Device

request.description: **This API is called to query historical data about a device shadow.**
**An NA can call this API to create device groups on the IoT platform.**
**An NA can call this API to create device groups on the IoT platform.**

item.name: 2.5.3 Querying Information About a Specified Device Group

request.description: **Querying Information About a Specified Device Group**
**Modifying Information About a Device Group**
**An NA can call this API to delete a specified device group.**

item.name: 2.5.6 Querying Members of a Specified Device Group

request.description: **An NA can call this API to query information about members in a specified device group.**

item.name: 2.5.7 Adding Members to a Device Group

request.description: **An NA can call this API to add a device to a specified device group.**

item.name: 2.5.8 Deleting Members from a Device Group

request.description: **An NA can call this API to delete devices from the device group.**

**The device profile file defines commands that the IoT platform can deliver to a device. When an NA needs to configure or modify the service attributes of a device, the NA can call this API to deliver commands to the device.**
**The IoT platform provides two command delivery modes:**
- **Immediate delivery: The IoT platform delivers commands to devices immediately after receiving the commands. This ensures real-time performance but does not ensure serialization.**
- **Pending delivery: After receiving commands, the IoT platform caches the commands. When the devices are reachable, the IoT platform delivers the commands in sequence. Specifically, the IoT platform delivers the latter command only after receiving the response of the previous command (which is the ACK automatically replied by the module) to ensure serialization instead of real-time performance.**
**After an NA delivers a command to a device, the NA can call this API to query the status and content of the delivered command on the IoT platform to check the command execution status.**
**NAs can call this API to modify the status of commands that have not been canceled, expired, or executed. Currently, the status of such commands can only be changed to** ***Canceled.***
**After delivering a command revocation command to a device, an NA can call this API to query the execution status of the command revocation task.**

item.name: 2.7.5 Creating a Device Command Revocation Task

request.description: **After an NA delivers commands to a device, the IoT platform does not deliver the commands to the device for execution** ***(the commands are in the DEFAULT state)*** **if the commands are in queue or the device is offline. In this case, the NA can call this API to revoke all the undelivered commands of a specified device. Commands that have been delivered cannot be revoked.**

item.name: *2.7.6 Delivering a Command to a Device Service

request.description: **The device profile file defines commands that the IoT platform can deliver to a device. When an NA needs to configure or modify the service attributes of a device, the NA can call this API to deliver commands to the device. The IoT platform does not cache commands but delivers commands directly. When a device is offline, the commands fail to be delivered. The formats of the delivered command need to be defined by the NAs and devices. The IoT platform encapsulates and transparently transmits the commands over this API.**

**This API is used by an NA to subscribe to service change notifications on the IoT platform:**

- **When the device status or data changes, the IoT platform pushes notifications to the NA.**

- **When an event occurs, the NA receives a notification.**

**This API is used by an NA to query the configuration information about a subscription by subscription ID on the IoT platform.**

***para. subscriptionId must be defined!***

**This API is used by an NA to delete the configuration information about a subscription by subscriptionId on the IoT platform.**

***para. subscriptionId must be defined!***
**This API is used to query subscription information with AppId and notifyType specified.**
**An NA deletes subscription information in batches.**

**This API is used by an NA to subscribe to service change notifications on the IoT platform. When the device status or data changes, the IoT platform pushes notifications to the NA. When an event occurs, the NA receives a notification.**

**Before upgrading the device version, an NA can call this API to query the version upgrade packages that have been uploaded to the IoT platform to ensure that the target version package has been uploaded.**
**Before upgrading the device version, an NA can call this API to query the target version upgrade package to ensure that it has been uploaded to the IoT platform.**
**If a device version package is no longer needed, an NA can call this API to delete the version package from the IoT platform.**

**If the device firmware needs to be upgraded, an NA can call this API to create a firmware upgrade task for multiple devices. Before the upgrade, ensure that the target version package has been uploaded to the IoT platform. Currently, only the firmware of NB-IoT devices can be upgraded.**

**If the device software needs to be upgraded, an NA can call this API to create a software upgrade task for multiple devices. Before the upgrade, ensure that the target version package has been uploaded to the IoT platform. Currently, only the software of NB-IoT devices can be upgraded.**

**If the device software needs to be upgraded, an NA can call this API to create a software upgrade task for multiple devices. Before the upgrade, ensure that the target version package has been uploaded to the IoT platform. Currently, only the software of NB-IoT devices can be upgraded.**

item.name: 2.10.4 Querying Details About a Specified Task

request.description: **If the device software needs to be upgraded, an NA can call this API to create a software upgrade task for multiple devices. Before the upgrade, ensure that the target version package has been uploaded to the IoT platform. Currently, only the software of NB-IoT devices can be upgraded.**

item.name: 2.10.5 Querying Subtask Information of a Specified Task

request.description: **After a device software or firmware upgrade task is created, the upgrade of each device involved in the task is a subtask (the number of subtasks is the same as that of the devices involved in the task). An NA can call this API to query details about subtasks of the upgrade task to check their execution status.**
